title: U.S. Jobless Claims Fall to 166,000, Lowest Level Since 1968
sub_head: Decline in initial claims for jobless benefits reflects strong demand for workers
body:
New applications for U.S. unemployment benefits fell last week to a near 54-year low as employers held on to workers in a tight labor market.
Initial jobless claims, a proxy for layoffs, fell to 166,000 during the week that ended on April 2, compared with a revised 171,000 the prior week, the Labor Department said Thursday. Economists expected 200,000 new claims last week.
